definition: (of a pair of horses) to pull side by side/to be side by side/to be fused together/parallel (literary style)

sentences.english: The parallel style official documents is a kind of unique style in the fields of the official document writing.
sentences.chinese: 骈体公文是中国古代公文写作领域特有的一种文体。

sentences.english: It is the concrete application of the parallel style in the official document writing.
sentences.chinese: 它是骈体在公文写作领域中的具体运用。

sentences.english: It is the concrete application of the parallel style in the official documents writing.
sentences.chinese: 它是骈体在公文写作领域中的具体运用。

definition: regular verse/strict poetic form with eight lines of 5, 6 or 7 syllables and even lines rhyming
old language/the Classics/Classical Chinese as a literary model, esp. in Tang and Song prose/Classical Chinese as a school subject
eight-part essay one had to master to pass the imperial exams in Ming and Qing dynasties
a genre of poetry, developed in the Tang Dynasty, characterized by its strict form
parallel and antithesis (paired sentences as rhetoric device)
old form of writing/piece in the old style
poetry in the style of 離騷|离骚[Li2 Sao1]
a pre-Tang Dynasty genre of poetry, relatively free in form, usually having four, five, six or seven characters per line
